articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Thousands of people rallied in the Romanian capital Bucharest late on Thursday in support of democracy ahead of a Sunday presidential election runoff that could see a far-right critic of the EU defeat a pro-European centrist candidate.
articles.title: Thousands attend pro-European rally in Romania ahead of presidential run-off vote

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: The main opposition Democratic Party has scheduled an impeachment vote for Saturday evening.
articles.title: Ruling party leader says South Korea president must be suspended as soon as possible

articles.author: Benoit Van Overstraeten
articles.description: President Emmanuel Macron began his latest search for a new prime minister to lead France's unruly parliament, after rejecting demands he quit to end a crisis he said was driven by the far right and extreme left's "anti-republican front."
articles.title: Emmanuel Macron struggles on in search for stable French government

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces stormed into Kamal Adwan Hospital in Beit Lahiya in north Gaza overnight on Friday and expelled some staff and displaced people before withdrawing, and bodies of people killed by airstrikes littered the streets outside, its director said.
articles.title: Israeli forces storm into Gaza hospital, expel some staff, displaced people, its director says

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Iran is "dramatically" increasing the amount of uranium enriched to up to 60% purity, close to the roughly 90% of weapons grade, that it is able to produce, the watchdog's chief Rafael Grossi told Reuters in an interview.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran 'dramatically' increasing enrichment to near bomb grade -IAEA chief

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of people fled the central Syrian city of Homs overnight and into Friday morning, a war monitoring group and residents said, as rebel forces sought to push their lightning offensive against government forces further south.
articles.title: Thousands flee as Syrian rebels push on towards Homs

articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Iraqi Shi'ite Muslim ruling parties and armed groups are weighing the pros and cons of armed intervention in Syria, viewing as a grave threat the advance of Sunni Islamist rebels who have taken two Syrian cities and now bear down on a third.
articles.title: War-weary Iraq weighs Syria intervention as rebels advance

articles.author: Michel Rose
articles.description: The reopening of Notre-Dame cathedral, five years after being devastated by a fire, was supposed to be Emmanuel Macron's triumph.
articles.title: As Notre-Dame reopens, Macron stands in ashes of French political edifice

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Norwegian decathlete Sander Skotheim has been given the International Fair Play Award by World Athletics, for the unselfish support he showed to teammate and gold medallist Markus Rooth at the Paris Olympics.
articles.title: Unselfish act earns Norwegian decathlete Skotheim international award

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The European Union and the South American bloc Mercosur of Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay and Uruguay finalised a free trade agreement on Friday, although it faces a tough battle to secure approval by the 27 EU member states.
articles.title: What's in the newly finalised EU-Mercosur trade accord?
